Package tage.networking.client

Interface IClientSocket

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TCPClientSocket, UDPClientSocket
    public interface IClientSocket
    Defines a client side socket responsible for sending an receiving packets for the client side of a game.
    Author:
    Kyle Matz Modified from the SAGE Networking package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Ported to TAGE by Scott Gordon.

      • connectTo

        void connectTo​(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddress,
               int remotePort)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Connects the client socket to the specified InetAddress and port. The client socket should be connected before being used.
        Parameters:
        remoteAddress - the address to connect the socket to.
        remotePort - the port to connect the socket to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • send

        void send​(java.io.Serializable object)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a Serializable object to the remote InetAddress and port that this client socket is connected to.
        Parameters:
        object - the Serializable objet to send.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receive

        java.lang.Object receive()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Receives a packet from the remote InetAddress and port that this client socket is connected to.
        Returns:
        the Object received from the remote connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Shuts down this client socket. Responsible for cleaning up any necessary objects used by this socket.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
